organization.fullName: United States Naval Medical Center, San Diego

identificationModule.briefTitle: SMILE (Small Incision Lenticule Extraction) in the DoD (Department of Defense)
identificationModule.officialTitle: SMILE (Small Incision Lenticule Extraction) in the DoD (Department of Defense)

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: United States Naval Medical Center, San Diego

leadSponsor.name: United States Naval Medical Center, San Diego

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The Use of the VisuMaxTM Femtosecond Laser Small-Incision Lenticule Extraction (SMILE) Procedure for the Correction of Myopia with or without Astigmatism study is a prospective, non-randomized, multicenter clinical study that will be conducted by the Navy Refractive Surgery Center, Naval Medical Center San Diego, CA in collaboration with the U.S. Air Force 59th Medical Wing, Wilford Hall Eye Center, TX, and the U.S. Army Warfighter Refractive Eye Surgery Program and Research Center, Fort Belvoir Community Hospital, VA.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Prospective, multicenter, open-label, non-randomized clinical trial with bilateral commercial treatment for FDA approved indications and unilateral treatments for investigational refractive errors. Data from each treated eye of subjects will be treated independently. Monovision treatments and retreatments of the study eye will not be allowed during the course of the study. Successful bilateral treatment is required for performance based testing and patient reported outcome testing. Subjects will be randomized into the 0.25 and 0.50 sphere only and spherical cylinder bins using a sequential alternating randomization with an equal number assigned to both bins. Other subjects will be assigned to the bins they qualify for as they are enrolled into the study. Appointments are given to patients requesting refractive surgery randomly.

Three military sites in the U.S.A.: Navy Refractive Surgery Center, Naval Medical Center San Diego, CA in collaboration with the U.S. Air Force 59th Medical Wing, Wilford Hall Eye Center, TX, and the U.S. Army Warfighter Refractive Eye Surgery Program and Research Center, Fort Belvoir Community Hospital, VA.

armGroups.label: Low cylinder (treatment)
armGroups.description: 0.25D and 0.50D cylinder treatments will be measured and treated by the laser.

armGroups.label: Low cylinder (no treatment)
armGroups.description: 0.25D and 0.50D cylinder treatments will be measured but not treated by the laser. No spherical equivalent will be used.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Measured postoperative refractive sphere and cylinder
primaryOutcomes.description: manifest refraction spherical equivalent and manifest refractive cylinder refraction
uncorrected visual acuity of 20/40 or better

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Measured difference in manifest refraction between 2 postoperative visits
secondaryOutcomes.description: 95% of eyes \<1.00D of MRSE change at latter of 2 postop refractions
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: latter of 2 postoperative refractions performed at least 3 months apart or at 3 months after surgery when compared with the 1 month interval

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Calculated rate of change in manifest refraction
secondaryOutcomes.description: mean rate of change of MRSE \<0.5D/year (0.04D/mo)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: latter of 2 postoperative refractions performed at least 3 months apart or at 3 months after surgery when compared with the 1 month interval

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Calculated decreased rate of change in manifest refraction
secondaryOutcomes.description: mean rate of change of MRSE decreases monotonically over time
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: latter of 2 postoperative refractions performed at least 3 months apart or at 3 months after surgery when compared with the 1 month interval

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Calculated stable rate of change in manifest refraction
secondaryOutcomes.description: 95% CI for the mean rate of change includes zero
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: latter of 2 postoperative refractions performed at least 3 months apart or at 3 months after surgery when compared with the 1 month interval

secondaryOutcomes.description: incidence of best spectacled correction worse than 20/40
incidence of loss of \>2 lines of best spectacled corrected visual acuity

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of patient reported visual phenomena

secondaryOutcomes.description: change in contrast sensitivity from preop to postop

overallOfficials.name: John B. Cason, M.D.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Data will be shared with Zeiss Meditech by Data Sharing Agreement and with the FDA
